availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Birch Musselman (Jefferson County, Kentucky, farmer and Provisional Government financial agents)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, tobacconist, farmer and Provisional Government financial agent. Pennsylvania native. Married Mary Ann Seedy Musselman in Jefferson County on December 22, 1842. Stepfather of Samuel Hammond and Josephine Hammond. Married to Sarah V. Cochran Musselman on December 28, 1854 in Jefferson County. Father of David Musselman, William Musselman, and Henry Musselman. Tobacconist in Louisville, Kentucky in 1850. Owned four enslaved person in Louisville in 1850. Household owned additional four enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Farmer in Jefferson County, Kentucky in 1860. Employed Thomas Esterly and George Greathouse in Jefferson County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 7, p. 376B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 7, p. 874.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 1050.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 247A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000817884, p. 173.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jeffferson County Marriages, Film #000482708, p. 359.
Find A Grave, "Birch Mussleman (1813-1887)," Memorial #77367040, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/77367040 (accessed April 7, 2020).
Matthew C. Hulbert, “Grabbing Guns and Breaking Banks: The Short, Ambitious “Reign” of Kentucky’s Provisional Confederate Government,” Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition blog, March 9, 2016, http://civilwargovernors.org/grabbing-guns-and-breaking-banks-the-short-ambitious-reign-of-kentuckys-provisional-confederate-government (accessed January 25, 2020).
